references.B73PAT01USGP: Pattie, D. 1973. Sorex bendirii in Mammalian Species 27. American Society of Mammalogists. Pp. 1-2.
references.B65ING01NAUS: Ingles, L.G. 1965. Mammals of the Pacific States. Stanford University Press, Stanford, CA. 506pp.

habitat_description: The Marsh Shrew (Sorex bendirii) is a riparian specialist that inhabits coniferous and mixed forests with coarse wood debris and wet areas, swamps, marshes, damp ravines, and beaches of coastal rainforests (Ingles 1965, NatureServe 2014).  It is usually found near water, but may be found up to 1 km from water sources during moist portions of winter (Pattie 1973).  N. Tarr, 2July2014.
